message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.DC 

This paper deals with the optimization of resource allocation, pricing, and file scheduling in a cellular network that provides both broadcast and unicast services. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. The paper also considers the characteristics of the content being broadcasted, such as file size and delay tolerance, which suggests that it could also belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of multimedia services, which could place it in the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The paper also discusses the coordination of multiple cells in a broadcast network, which could make it relevant to the Signal and Image Processing (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the optimization of resource allocation, which could also place it in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category.
